milestones.eventDescription: First artificial Earth satellite. Transmitted simple radio beeps and was tracked worldwide before reentering after ~3 months.
significance: Catalyzed the Space Race and rapid investment in science/engineering education and R&D
Demonstrated long-range rocket capability with major geopolitical impact

milestones.eventDescription: Carried the dog Laika into orbit to study life support and biomedical responses to spaceflight. No recovery system was available.
significance: Advanced bioastronautics and life-support design for later human flights
Raised early ethical debates about animals in space research

milestones.eventDescription: JPL/ABMA launch of the first American satellite. Its instruments detected charged-particle counts that revealed Earth’s radiation belts.
significance: Discovery of the Van Allen radiation belts, foundational to space environment science
Established a working U.S. orbital launch capability

milestones.eventDescription: Tiny 1.47 kg spacecraft using solar cells to power its transmitter. Provided geodetic data on Earth’s shape and atmospheric drag.
significance: Proved solar power for spacecraft, a standard ever since
Long orbital lifetime enabled studies of upper-atmosphere density

milestones.eventDescription: Soviet probe performed the first successful lunar encounter, impacting near Mare Imbrium after a direct trajectory.
significance: First human-made object to reach another celestial body
Validated navigation and deep-space tracking techniques

milestones.eventSubtitle: First Images of the Moon’s Far Side
milestones.eventDescription: Returned grainy but historic photographs of the lunar far side using onboard film development and scan-line transmission.
significance: Revealed far-side terrain, reshaping lunar mapping and geology
Demonstrated complex autonomous imaging and data relay in deep space
